creator: michael.straessle@bk.admin.ch
text:
hi
my release build fails with following errors:

.....
        NMAKE -nologo -f gen_test_char.mak   CFG="gen_test_char - Win32 Release"
 RECURSE=0
        if not exist ".\Release/" mkdir ".\Release"
        cl.exe @C:\TEMP\nma00256.
gen_test_char.c
        link.exe @C:\TEMP\nmb00256.
        cd ..
        del Release\buildmark.obj
Das System kann die angegebene Datei nicht finden.
        NMAKE -nologo -f libhttpd.mak        CFG="libhttpd - Win32 Release" RECU
RSE=0
        if not exist ".\Release/" mkdir ".\Release"
        tempfile.bat
Ungültige Option - /y
Created mod_dav.h
        tempfile.bat
Ungültige Option - /y
Created os.h
        cl.exe /nologo /MD /W3 /O2 /I "./include" /I "./srclib/apr/include" /I "
./srclib/apr-util/include" /D "NDEBUG" /D "WIN32" /D "_WINDOWS" /D "AP_DECLARE_E
XPORT" /Fo".\Release\\" /Fd".\Release\libhttpd" /FD /c .\server\buildmark.c
buildmark.c
./include\ap_config.h(268) : fatal error C1083: Cannot open include file: 'os.h'
: No such file or directory
NMAKE : fatal error U1077: 'cl.exe' : return code '0x2'
Stop.
....

did i miss something?

TIA
michael

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
This is a known problem that is fixed in 2.0.37.  NT didn't support copy /y
  while all 9x, 2k and XP did.  Sorry that slipped into a release, if you 
  modify the .dsp files directly and replace any xcopy /y or xcopy /y commands
  to remove the /y option, you will build fine.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text: *** Bug 9742 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

confirmed. compilation of a 2.0.37-dev snapshot dating june 10 did compile fine 
(only a warning about not beeing able to read ApacheMonitorVersion.rc). that 
will do for my testing purposes.
